TextBody:
HI Michael,

If the computer does not show up in the EPP UI, it means that the agent on those machines didn't communicate with the server, that being also the reason for which the USB restriction is not enforced.

Can you please check in System Configuration - System Licensing to make sure you have available licenses and if so, then check if the EPP server IP is reachable from one of the machines in question?

Also, if there are available licenses, can you try uninstalling and reinstalling the EPP agent on one of the machines where the issue is present and let us know how it works afterwards?

Thank you and best regards,

__________________
Cristian Tornea
Senior Technical Support Engineer & Shift Lead  (US/Canada/LATAM)
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
 

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OQXAd:ref
Subject: USB Access Allowed When it Shouldn't    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OQXAd:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Michael,

Regarding your first question: the EPP does not automatically remove computers from the console. However, this issue may occur if the computer was never able to communicate with the EPP server after deployment.

For your second question: the EPP server communicates with its clients over port 443.

Please let us know if you need any further assistance.

Thank you!
Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
 www.endpointprotector.com

Hi Michael,

Regarding your first question: the EPP does not automatically remove computers from the console. However, this issue may occur if the computer was never able to communicate with the EPP server after deployment.

For your second question: the EPP server communicates with its clients over port 443.

Please let us know if you need any further assistance.

Thank you!

Best Regards,

Subject: Re: USB Access Allowed When it Shouldn't [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OQXAd:ref ]



Hello,

 

I provided a screenshot of our licensing and if the device can reach the EPP server. It seems this device cannot reach the server… If a device cannot reach the server, would it remove the device automatically from the EPP console?

IT Security Manager

825 Industrial Road, Floor 1

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Date: Thursday, April 24, 2025 at 3:19?PM
To: Michael Aquinde <michael.aquinde@iovance.com>
Subject: USB Access Allowed When it Shouldn't [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OQXAd:ref ]



CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. DO NOT click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 


 


HI Michael,

If the computer does not show up in the EPP UI, it means that the agent on those machines didn't communicate with the server, that being also the reason for which the USB restriction is not enforced.

Can you please check in System Configuration - System Licensing to make sure you have available licenses and if so, then check if the EPP server IP is reachable from one of the machines in question?

Also, if there are available licenses, can you try uninstalling and reinstalling the EPP agent on one of the machines where the issue is present and let us know how it works afterwards?

Thank you and best regards,

__________________
Cristian Tornea
Senior Technical Support Engineer & Shift Lead  (US/Canada/LATAM)
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix

TextBody:
Hi Michael,

Thank you for joining today's remote session.

As discussed, it appears that the EPP agent was deployed without the server IP and port being correctly configured. Please refer to the Intune deployment documentation for EPP here:
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4.2/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Install/Agent/Intune/WindowsDeployment.htm

As agreed, we are closing this ticket for now. However, if you encounter any issues during the re-deployment, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Thank you!

Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
